Share: Digg Facebook StumbleUpon 2-Stage Cannings Cross Wheat Formation Scene of Farm Arrest © 2009 by Linda Moulton Howe C annings Cross, Wiltshire, crop formation has evolved through farmer damage from June 27, 2009, to mysterious July 10, 2009, second stage reconstruction to July 13, 2009, arrest of farm employee with shot gun. P art 1 of Cannings Cross near Allington, Wiltshire, England, showing June 27, 2009, first reported pattern after the angry farmer drove his tractor around in circles cutting off the points of the interior pattern. Aerial image © 2009 by Eva-Marie Brekkestø. P hotoshop reconstruction of formation to illustrate pattern before the farmer drove around in circles cutting off the inner points. Electronic reconstruction © 2009 by Psycho Clown. P art 2 of Cannings Cross near Allington, Wiltshire, England, reported on July 10, 2009, with additional circles at the outer points. Inside the farmer's original June 27th circles of wheat cut down, the cut off interior points have been reconstructed into fresh, new points. Aerial image © 2009 by Olivier Morel (WCCSG). For other images and information: Cropcircleconnector. July 4, 2009 Cannings Cross near Allington, Wiltshire County, England - The Cannings Cross wheat pattern near Allington, Wiltshire, England, has been evolving through great confusion. The farm owner originally took his tractor into the first part of the formation reported on June 27, 2009, and drove in big circles to cut down the interior

points of the pattern. Eva-Marie Brekkestø flew over the pattern after the farmer's destruction and took the first aerial photograph. A computer graphics artist north of Wiltshire known as Psycho Clown then volunteered to reconstruct what the formation looked like before the farmer's tractor destruction and produced a Photoshop reconstruction. Then on July 10, the formation evolved into a second part with more circles added to the outside points and the damaged interior points were reconstructed into fresh points. By the night of July 12 to 13, the angry farm owner apparently hired a man to walk the field with a gun and shoot any “croppies” that entered. Then yesterday afternoon, July 13, 2009, the Wiltshire Police arrested either the hired man or the farmer allegedly for firing a shot gun. The news was carried in the July 14, 2009, edition of the Gazette & Herald. T uesday, July 14, 2009, Gazette & Herald, Wiltshire, England. This morning, July 14, 2009, I also received the following communication from Psycho Clown and report it here for more clarity. As this story continues to unfold, Earthfiles will report follow ups on the police arrest and any more additions or changes to the Allington formation. From: thepsychoclown Subject: Re: From Linda Moulton Howe inquiry, July 14, 2009 Date: July 14, 2009 11:03:35 AM MDT To: earthfiles@earthfiles.com Hi Linda The formation was reported first on June 27th, and before anyone could get in the air to photograph it, the farmer took his mower to it and partially destroyed it. I have attached the original photo taken by Eva-Marie Brekkestø in it's unaltered state, this file is called “gfdre.jpg.” [ after the farmer drove around the circle cutting off the inner formation points.] P art 1 of Cannings Cross wheat formation near Allington, Wiltshire, England, first reported June 27, 2009. Then the farmer took his tractor and cut down the formation where the round rings of destruction are between outer points and inner points. Aerial image © 2009 by Eva-Marie Brekkestø. I have also attached my reconstructed (Photoshopped) version that I posted on

the Crop Circle Connector Forum and was then subsequently transferred to the CCC page relating to the Cannings Cross formation, this file is called “canningscross2009.jpg.” P hotoshop reconstruction of formation to illustrate pattern before the farmer drove around in circles cutting off the inner points. Electronic reconstruction © 2009 by Psycho Clown. Then on Friday, July 10th, the formation was reported again to have extended with extra grape shots and neatened back up. P art 2 of Cannings Cross near Allington, Wiltshire, England, reported on July 10, 2009, with additional circles at the outer points. Inside the farmer's original June 27th circles of wheat cut down, the cut off interior points have been reconstructed into fresh, new points. Aerial image © 2009 by Olivier Morel (WCCSG). The latest events are quite bizarre (the farmer was arrested yesterday for brandishing a gun at police and passers by. Hope this helps. Psycho Clown PS: I don't usually use my real name. It's for no other reason than usually I like to keep myself to myself, hope you understand. Thanks.
